text: I've seen so many companies do extremely well with it, and I would say that not all companies will be successful, period. Companies that are really successful with it are companies that... I think I can swear a little, they have their shit together.
speaker: Christina Wodtke
context: Lenny inquires about the impact of OKRs on companies and asks Christina to share insights on their effectiveness. Christina asserts that successful companies using OKRs have a solid foundation, including strategy and empowered teams. She emphasizes that OKRs should not be seen as a cure-all but rather as a tool that amplifies existing strengths.
text_ko: 많은 회사들이 그걸로 정말 잘 되는 걸 봤어요. 하지만 모든 회사가 성공할 수 있는 건 아니에요. 진짜 성공하는 회사들은... 솔직히 말하자면, 그들은 정말 잘 정리되어 있어요.
text_zh: 我看到很多公司在这方面表现非常出色，但我必须说，并不是所有公司都能成功。那些真正成功的公司，都是那些……我想我可以稍微直白一点，他们的管理非常到位。
text_es: He visto a muchas empresas tener un gran éxito con ello, y diría que no todas las empresas tendrán éxito, punto. Las empresas que realmente tienen éxito son aquellas que... creo que puedo decirlo de esta manera, tienen todo bajo control.

text: I say OKRs are more of a vitamin, they're not a medicine. So, if you take OKRs and you're like, 'Oh, this will fix everything that's wrong with you.' No, that's not going to happen. It's just going to reveal everything that's wrong with your company.
speaker: Christina Wodtke
context: Lenny wants to highlight the benefits of OKRs and how they can lead to organizational success. Christina illustrates that OKRs should be viewed as a preventative measure that enhances a company’s existing capabilities instead of a fix for underlying issues. She explains that instead of solving problems, OKRs will expose them, necessitating prior organizational health for effective implementation.
text_ko: 저는 OKR이 비타민 같다고 생각해요. 약이 아니라는 거죠. 그래서 OKR을 도입하고 '이게 내 모든 문제를 해결해줄 거야'라고 생각하면 안 돼요. 그런 일은 일어나지 않아요. 오히려 회사의 문제점을 드러내줄 뿐이에요.
text_zh: 我认为OKR更像是一种维生素，而不是药物。如果你认为使用OKR就能解决你公司所有的问题，那是不可能的。它只是会揭示出你公司存在的所有问题。
text_es: Yo digo que los OKRs son más como una vitamina, no son una medicina. Así que, si tomas OKRs y piensas: 'Oh, esto solucionará todo lo que está mal contigo.' No, eso no va a suceder. Simplemente va a revelar todo lo que está mal en tu empresa.

text: The main benefit is that there's a lot of concrete action through an OKR that you don't always get from strategy. Strategy tends to be a little longer, a little more Muji Muji.
speaker: Christina Wodtke
context: Lenny asks Christina to summarize the primary benefits of using OKRs for organizations. Christina explains that OKRs provide actionable and measurable outcomes, while strategies can often be vague and abstract. By implementing OKRs, teams can establish concrete steps towards achieving their goals, thereby creating accountability and progress.
text_ko: 주요 장점은 OKR을 통해 구체적인 행동이 많이 나온다는 거예요. 전략에서는 항상 그런 게 나오지 않거든요. 전략은 좀 더 긴 시간과 모호한 부분이 있는 것 같아요.
text_zh: 主要的好处在于，通过OKR（目标与关键结果）可以实现很多具体的行动，而这些在战略中并不总是能得到。战略往往比较长远，有些模糊。
text_es: El principal beneficio es que hay mucha acción concreta a través de un OKR (Objectives and Key Results) que no siempre se obtiene de la estrategia. La estrategia tiende a ser un poco más prolongada, un poco más abstracta.

text: One of the biggest problems founders struggle with is they don't scale very well, but if you can set a good OKR and get people to work on it, then you don't have to decide all those little IC tasks.
speaker: Christina Wodtke
context: Lenny prompts Christina to discuss the advantages of OKRs in scaling organizations. Christina points out that an effective OKR framework allows leaders to focus on high-level objectives rather than micromanaging individual contributor tasks. This strategic approach helps in maintaining clarity and efficiency as a company grows.
text_ko: 창업자들이 가장 힘들어하는 문제 중 하나는 잘 확장되지 않는다는 거예요. 하지만 좋은 OKR(목표 및 핵심 결과)을 설정하고 사람들이 그에 맞춰 일하게 하면, 작은 IC(개별 기여자) 작업들을 일일이 결정할 필요가 없어요.
text_zh: 创始人面临的最大问题之一是他们的扩展能力有限，但如果能够设定一个良好的OKR（目标与关键成果），并让团队围绕这个目标工作，那么就不必亲自决定所有的小的个体贡献（IC）任务。
text_es: Uno de los mayores problemas que enfrentan los fundadores es que no escalan muy bien, pero si puedes establecer un buen OKR (Objective and Key Results) y lograr que las personas trabajen en él, entonces no tendrás que decidir sobre todas esas pequeñas tareas individuales.

text: You have to think about, if somebody doesn't know what to do and you're like, 'Well, I have a strategy. I told you what my strategy is.' And they don't know how to make decisions, it means something's wrong with the strategy or you aren't being clear.
speaker: Christina Wodtke
context: Lenny asks Christina about the root causes of issues that arise with OKRs. Christina explains that if team members are unclear about their tasks or objectives, it reflects a failure in communication or strategic clarity from leadership. This highlights the importance of transparent and effective communication in fostering a productive work environment.
text_ko: 누군가 뭘 해야 할지 모른다면, '내가 전략이 있어. 내 전략이 뭐라고 했는지 말했잖아.'라고 해도 그 사람이 결정을 못 한다면, 그건 전략에 문제가 있거나 내가 명확하게 설명하지 않았다는 거예요.
text_zh: 你需要考虑，如果有人不知道该怎么做，而你说：“我有一个策略。我告诉过你我的策略是什么。”如果他们仍然无法做出决策，这就意味着策略可能存在问题，或者你没有表达清楚。
text_es: Debes considerar que si alguien no sabe qué hacer y tú dices: 'Bueno, tengo una estrategia. Te he explicado cuál es mi estrategia.' Y esa persona no sabe cómo tomar decisiones, significa que hay algo mal con la estrategia o que no estás siendo claro.

text: You can either buy the obvious off-the-rack package like an NPS, or you can dig a little harder and figure out what would be meaningful to your company.
speaker: Christina Wodtke
context: Lenny discusses the challenges of measuring qualitative outcomes in product development. Christina encourages leaders to either utilize standard metrics like Net Promoter Score (NPS) or invest time in understanding what metrics would provide meaningful insights specific to their company. This underscores the importance of tailored measurement strategies to accurately assess user satisfaction and product impact.
text_ko: 당연히 NPS 같은 뻔한 패키지를 사는 것도 좋지만, 조금 더 깊이 파고들어서 우리 회사에 진짜 의미 있는 게 뭔지 알아보는 것도 중요해요.
text_zh: 您可以选择购买像NPS这样的现成解决方案，或者深入挖掘，找出对您的公司真正有意义的内容。
text_es: Puedes optar por comprar un paquete estándar como un NPS, o puedes profundizar un poco más y descubrir qué sería realmente significativo para tu empresa.
